authorCommits.message: Warn developers if they forget to set attachment_key on trix fields (#1451)
Don't set the csrf token if it's not available (#1452)
Don't swallow errors with labels and descriptions (#1359)

Made it possible to customise the placeholder image (#1269)

Co-authored-by: Adrian <adrian@adrianthedev.com>

Made sure model is set on the resource for actions (#1211)

Co-authored-by: Adrian <adrian@adrianthedev.com>
Use translations for polymorphic class names (#1204)

Make sure null appears as "" in key value fields (#1100)

Co-authored-by: Adrian Marin <adrian@adrianthedev.com>

Use `underscore_name` instead of `name.underscore` (#1094)

There's a bug in the trix field at the moment, where the `input` attribute of the `<trix-editor>` tag can include spaces whenever you have a resource with more than one word in it's name. If you have a resource named `MyPost` then `@resource.name` will be `My post`, `@resource.name.underscore` will be `my post` and therefore `trix_id` will be `trix_my post_foo` (if the field is named `foo`).

To fix this I've changed it to use the class name instead of the human readable name,
then calling underscore on that.

Made sure the init script builds assets (#1095)

System specs won't run unless assets are compiled
(if you try, you get a lot of errors about missing
assets).

I've added commands to the init script to build
assets in the same way as the github actions test
workflow does, and this allows tests to run (after
running the init script).

Removed the custom course resource controller (#965)

Co-authored-by: Adrian Marin <adrian@adrianthedev.com>
